subject: Re: JUnit Failure Trace not printed completely
msgSnippet: The problem is that we use a bad style JUnit test in my eyes because of this problem. public void testXyz() { try { // a exception occurs } catch(Exception e)
messageBody:
The problem is that we use a bad style JUnit test in my eyes because
of this problem.

public void testXyz()
{
try
{
// a exception occurs
}
catch(Exception e)
{
e.printStackTrace();
}
}

instead of:

public void testXyz() throws Exception
{
// a exception occurs
}

Now try to convince the coworkers to copy the trace to an editor
instead of writing the stack trace to the console...

Any ideas?
